files.description: Implements a Python CLI command that scans runtime/outputs/, syncs artifacts into the canonical outputs/ tree, optionally rewrites in-repo references, and emits outputs/qa/path_canonicalization_report.md summarizing moves, duplicates, and actions taken.
Defines the cli package entry points and exports the path canonicalization command for integration with the existing CLI tool.
Provides reusable library functions for file discovery, copy/sync logic, hashing/duplicate detection, reference rewriting, and markdown report generation used by the CLI command.
End-to-end tests using temporary directories to validate syncing from runtime/outputs to outputs, duplicate handling, optional reference rewriting, and correct markdown report emission.
Focused tests covering safe reference rewriting behavior (e.g., runtime/outputs to outputs) with allow/deny patterns and dry-run mode.
Documents the canonical-path enforcement command usage, options, safety guarantees, expected report contents, and migration guidance for developers and CI.

missionDescription: Create a canonical-path enforcement + migration step: ensure that artifacts currently generated under runtime/outputs/ (e.g., generated reports, schemas, tools) are copied/synced into the canonical /outputs/ tree, and update references accordingly. Emit a /outputs/qa/path_canonicalization_report.md listing what moved and what remains duplicated.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
Multiple agents failed to discover artifacts (0 documents analyzed) due to runtime/outputs vs /outputs ambiguity. Without a mechanical sync/enforcement step, QA and indexing will keep failing.
